TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ReadEntityBodyMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies constants that indicate how the entity body of an HTTP request has been read.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.ReadEntityBodyMode Buffered = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The entity body has been read into a T:System.IO.Stream?qualifyHint=False

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.ReadEntityBodyMode Bufferless = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The entity body has been read into a T:System.IO.Stream?qualifyHint=False

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.ReadEntityBodyMode Classic = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The entity body has already been read and its contents have been put into HTTP request collections like <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest.Form%2A>, <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest.Files%2A>, <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest.InputStream%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest.BinaryRead%2A>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Classic mode applies when ASP.NET pipeline processing has already occurred. For example, running an ASP.NET page or accessing a property in one of the HTTP request collections causes the entity body to be read, and the entity body contents are then put into the appropriate collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.ReadEntityBodyMode None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The entity body has not been read.
